My situation is to build your test suite manually, then change your test ca=
se class' constructor to accept the parameters that you need to take.

suit=
e() {
    TestSuite suite =3D new TestSuite();

    loop somehow {
        =
suite.addTest(new ParameterizedTestCase(param1, param2, ...));
    }

    r=
eturn suite;
}

ParameterizedTestCase(param1, param2, ...) {
    super(make=
SuiteName(param1, param2, ...));
    this.param1 =3D param1;
    ...
}

sta=
tic String makeSuiteName(...) {
    return "ParameterizedTestCase<" + param=
1 + ", " + param2 + ... + ">";
}

The key points are these:

* Build your t=
est suite by looping over the set of parameters you need to pass.
* Code a =
method to build a meaningful test case name from your parameters.
* Code yo=
ur constructor to accept all the parameters your test needs.
* Store the pa=
rameters in the test's fixture.
* Code your test methods normally.

That sh=
ould help you get on your way.

>So said Thomas Porter on 2003-05-31 ------=

va Extreme

e test with
>a
>single test method multiple times with different arguments =
being passed to
>the
>test method for each iteration.
>

 looked at the formater output from a test like this I
>would

 test name / test method name repeated once for each iteration.

have seen the API javadoc on the setName() method, I do not

, nor do I know if it would affect the formatter output.  I would

=
>the

et the

n the

umens
>to

) and ant
>(1.5.3) I use, do not seem to display the sysout output in the j=
unitreport
>html
>pages.
>
>
